Material used.Description: The experiment was conducted using HEK293 cells transfected with LRRK2 variants.

Readout description.Result Description: Increased kinase activity observed in cells with the p.G202S variant.
Reduced kinase activity in cells with the p.P482L variant.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type LRRK2 cDNA was used as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-way ANOVA with post-hoc Tukey's test was used.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Kinase activity within 10% of wild-type levels.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Kinase activity deviating by more than 25% from wild-type levels.

Material used.Material Name: Postmortem brain tissue from Parkinson's patients
Material used.Description: Immunoprecipitation was performed on brain tissue samples from Parkinson's patients and controls.

Readout description.Result Description: LRRK2 p.G202S showed enhanced aggregation in patient-derived tissue.
LRRK2 p.P482L exhibited decreased protein levels in patient samples.

Biological replicates.Description: Five brain tissue samples were analyzed.

Technical replicates.Description: No technical replicates were explicitly mentioned.

Basic positive control.Description: Control brain tissue from non-Parkinson's individuals was used.

Basic negative control.Description: No negative control was explicitly described.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Unpaired t-test was used for comparison between groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein aggregation levels similar to controls.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein aggregation levels 2x higher than controls.
